message.content:
cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.DB, cs.CL

This paper deals with mining collaborative tagging data to make recommendations for product design. This involves building a Naive Bayes Classifier for each tag and returning the top-k products that are likely to attract the maximum number of desirable tags when published. The problem of finding the top-k products is shown to be NP-complete, which suggests that this paper could belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) or Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the use of collaborative tagging data and the algorithms proposed for solving the problem suggest that this paper could also belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Databases (cs.DB), or Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-categories.
